post.author: na
post.content:
awesome!!
thanks,


>Qustion 1:
>There will be no way to find out the font face and setting information from the gif file itself.  You can consult with a visual designer who has some experience with typography to find out.  They should have a collection of fonts to compare your font in the graphic file.
>
>Question 2:
>I think this could be some options.
>- use <meta name="keywords" content="title, sub titles,.....so on>
>- use alt tags with each image such as below...
>  <img src="/images/home/aboutus.gif" width="100" height="100" border="0" alt="About Us" />
>
>*** alt tag is very important when you are using images on the web especially when dealing with accessbility.  Braille (reading tool for the visually challenged user) reads the alt tags on images.  I think this is the same concept.
>
>I hope this helps.
>Jay S.
>
>
>>I am updating company's web site.
>>All the title of the web site are image files.
>>However, I couldn't figure out which font it is, no way to connect the web solution company which initially created the web.
>>I only have gif format of images. How can I find out font and character info from gif image?  Is it possible?
>>Since every title and sub titles are image, search engines can't catch the content, is there any way to search engines catch the content by adding some comment or so ?
>>
>>
>
post.title: [re] about web site project
